benchmark_details.name: MMATH (A Multilingual Benchmark for Mathematical Reasoning)
benchmark_details.overview: MMATH is a benchmark for multilingual complex reasoning spanning 374 high-quality math problems across 10 typologically diverse languages. It aims to evaluate the capabilities of large language models (LLMs) in multilingual reasoning tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the multilingual complex reasoning capabilities of large language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Balancing accuracy and language consistency remains a significant challenge.

data.source: High-quality math problems sourced from AIME, CNMO, and MATH-500, translated into 10 languages.
data.annotation: Translated and validated through a pipeline combining LLM output and human verification.

methodology.calculation: Answer Accuracy measures the proportion of instances in which the model produces the correct final answer. Language Consistency Ratio quantifies the alignment between input and output languages.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in answer accuracy and LCR indicate better multilingual reasoning capabilities.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through extensive human evaluation with linguistic experts.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark covers a diverse set of languages which helps assess multilingual capabilities across different linguistic demographics.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential for underperformance in lower-resource languages.
